page.title: 13Conservation.
page.content: Farmers have spotted the following wildlife in the area in the past year badgers,foxes,pheasants,roe deer, partridges,mallard ducks and mandarin ducks.Also Canada geese which stop to graze on the way to Petworth Park and woodcocks,barn owls,sparrow_hawks kestrels which are birds of prey, snipe,lesser spotted woodpeckers,and green woodpeckers,hares,and rabbits. Mink are pests,and eat fish and poultry. Otterhounds now hunt them as there are no longer any otters left in the area.Nightingales have been seen as well as stoats and weasels.Some people in this area enjoy fox-hunting. Hunting is for conservation, as foxes need woodland and hedges for cover, and hedges hold mice, voles and rabbits which foxes eat.
